info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:06PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Siskiyou County through 530 PM PDT... At 506 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grenada, or 9 miles southeast of Yreka, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gazelle and Grenada. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
